byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from New Delhi, and Julfikar Ali Manik from Dhaka, Bangladesh.
byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and JULFIKAR ALI MANIK

abstract: Motiur Rahman Nizami, leader of Bangladesh's Islamist opposition party Jamaat-e-Islami, is executed for atrocities committed during country's 1971 war for independence; execution threatens to widen rift between defenders of country's secular identity and those who want Islamic government.

headline.print_headline: Islamist Leader Is Executed in Bangladesh
headline.main: Bangladesh Braces for Violence After Opposition Leader, Motiur Rahman Nizami, Is Executed

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Motiur Rahman Nizami, leader of the country’s largest Islamic party, was hanged on a 2014 conviction of committing atrocities in the 1971 war of independence.
lead_paragraph: Motiur Rahman Nizami, leader of the country’s largest Islamic party, was hanged on a 2014 conviction of committing atrocities in the 1971 war of independence.
